datascience.tables.Table¶

class datascience.tables.Table(columns=None, labels=None, formatter=<datascience.formats.Formatter object>)[source]¶

A sequence of labeled columns.

>>> letters = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'z']
>>> counts = [9, 3, 3, 1]
>>> points = [1, 2, 2, 10]
>>> t = Table([letters, counts, points], ['letter', 'count', 'points'])
>>> print(t)
letter | count | points
a      | 9     | 1
b      | 3     | 2
c      | 3     | 2
z      | 1     | 10
__init__(columns=None, labels=None, formatter=<datascience.formats.Formatter object>)[source]¶

Create a table from a list or dictionary of sequences.

columns – a dictionary of sequences keyed by label [labels == None] OR
a sequence of sequences [labels != None]

labels – a sequence of labels; columns must not contain labels

Methods

__init__([columns, labels, formatter]) Create a table from a list or dictionary of sequences.
append(row_or_table) Append a row or all rows of a table.
apply(fn, column_label) Apply a function to each element of a column.
as_html([max_rows]) Format table as HTML.
as_text([max_rows, sep]) Format table as text.
barh(column_for_categories[, overlay]) Plots horizontal bar charts for the table.
column_index(column_label) Return the index of a column.
copy() Return a copy of a Table.
drop(column_label_or_labels) Return a Table with only columns other than selected label or labels.
from_records(records) Create a table from a sequence of records (dicts with fixed keys).
from_rows(rows, column_labels) Create a table from a sequence of rows (fixed-length sequences).
group(column_or_label[, collect]) Group rows by unique values in column_label, aggregating values.
groups(column_labels[, collect]) Group rows by multiple columns, aggregating values.
hist([overlay]) Plots one histogram for each column in the table.
index_by(column_or_label) Return a dict keyed by values in a column that contains lists of rows corresponding to each value.
join(column_label, other[, other_label]) Generate a table with the columns of self and other, containing rows for all values of a column that appear in both tables.
matrix() Return a 2-D array with the contents of the table.
move_to_end(column_label) Move a column to the last in order.
move_to_start(column_label) Move a column to the first in order.
percentile(p) Assumes that each column only contains one type of value.
pivot(columns, rows, values[, collect, zero]) Generate a table with a column for rows (or a column for each row in rows list) and a column for each unique value in columns.
pivot_hist(pivot_column_label, ...[, overlay]) Draw histograms of each category in a column.
plot([column_for_xticks, overlay]) Plot contents as lines.
points(column__lat, column__long[, radii, ...])
read_table(filepath_or_buffer, *args, **vargs) Read a table from a file or web address.
relabel(column_label, new_label) Change the label of a column.
sample([k, with_replacement, weights]) Returns a new table
select(column_label_or_labels) Return a Table with selected column or columns by label.
set_format(column_label_or_labels, formatter) Set the format of a column.
show([max_rows]) Display the table.
sort(column_or_label[, descending, distinct]) Return a Table of sorted rows by the values in a column.
stack(key[, column_labels]) Takes k original columns and returns two columns, with col.
stats([ops]) Compute statistics for each column and place them in a table.
take(row_numbers) Return a Table of a sequence of rows taken by number.
where(column_or_label[, value]) Return a Table of rows for which the column is value or a non-zero value.
